conclusion: To determine the work done externally by the gas from state B to state C, analyze the process on the p-V diagram.
The process from B to C is an isobaric process (constant pressure).
The pressure at state B and C is 2 x 10^5 Pa.
At state B, the volume is 1 x 10^-3 m^3.
At state C, the volume is 3 x 10^-3 m^3.
The change in volume (ΔV) is 2 x 10^-3 m^3.
For an isobaric process, the work done by the gas is given by W = P ΔV.
Substituting the values, W = (2 x 10^5 Pa) x (2 x 10^-3 m^3) = 400 J.
The work done externally by the gas from state B to state C is 400 J.
